history.content:
Math 113 is a good class to take for building your math foundations!  It's really helpful and very very interesting.  A lot of people cite it as their favorite core math class at Berkeley (both math majors and other majors).  I'd recommend taking a look at the pdf of A First Course in Abstract Algebra by Fraleigh, just the first section or two, to see how familiar you are with the really introductory stuff.  But if you have 70 and 170, you have some familiarity with proofs, and if you have 54 and 16b, you're familiar already with what it means to study an algebraic object (in that case, vector spaces).  I will say that a lot of people don't like having to do proofs in 70, and I found that the proofs in 113 were a lot more fun to write than discrete math proofs.

Out of those professors, I'd really recommend Artamanov.  He's a really sweet and personable guy, if you take it with him try to get to know him a little bit.  I had him for Math 185 and really loved him (and algebra is his thing so I'm sure he'll be great for 113).  He's also not that tough as far as I gathered, homeworks were interesting and not too time consuming and exams were very fair and never too surprising.

I have heard good about Corwin, but I don't know too much.  I wouldn't recommend Vojta unless you really want a challenge, while being a great professor he also has his own style for 113 and it can be a little overwhelming if you haven't taken another upper div math course beforehand.

-----------------------------------

Different student here. I have artamanov for 104 currently, and he is definitely very nice but I personally don't like his lectures that much. He basically copies definitions, theorems, and proofs from the book, and only very occasionally stops for intuition. I also think he spends a little too much time going over basic definitions, and doesn't leave enough time for the more involved proofs. He does convey everything, but it is a bit dry to me sometimes. I agree the homeworks and exams are fair though. The only other thing you should probably take into consideration is that when asked what an average grade on an exam corresponded to, he said "probably a C+", so his curve is not very forgiving, assuming he does not change his answer by the end of the semester.

children.subject: Does anybody know more about Corwin? Thanks!

Hi, OP here - thanks very much for all of your very insightful responses! How did you feel about the workload of the class and about how many hours does the average problem set take? Is the workload roughly consistent across the semester or does it spike around certain topics? Thanks!

history.content: Hi! Has anyone taken math 113 and would be able to comment on its difficulty + how much you enjoyed the course/if you felt like it helps build a good math foundation? The only math-y classes I have taken are math 54 and cs 70 (+ ee 16 series and even less relevantly cs170 i guess). The 3 profs teaching it next semester are David Corwin, Semen Artamonov, and Paul Vojta.
history.subject: Taking Math 113 as a cs major?
